metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35001 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
Linux Kernel nftables Out-Of-Bounds Read/Write Vulnerability; nft_byteorderpoorly handled vm register contents when CAP_NET_ADMIN is in any user ornetwork namespace

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-194-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-194-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-194.245').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.183~14.04.1').
